column2: South Koreaâ€™s seven-piece boy band BTS (Bangtan Boys
column3: or â€œBulletproof Boy Scoutsâ€ in English) made history when they become the first k-pop band to win the Top Social Artist awardâ€”beating Justin Bieber
column5: and Ariana Grande to do it.On Monday
column6: their name was everywhere on U.S. outlets
column11: and more all posting explainers on who BTS is. This is BTSâ€™s biggest U.S. mainstream breakout moment yet
column12: but not their first. BTSâ€™s global A.R.M.Y fan base has steadily been building since the band got together in 2013. Their love of the band and social media power have helped propel the boys to a level of global recognition few other k-pop bands have achieved.BTSâ€™s membersâ€”Jin
column18: and Jungkookâ€”have released nine albums and are wrapping up Episode III of their worldwide Live Trilogy Tour. They write their own songs that cover many genres (everything from hip-hop and rap to power ballads) and have received accolades for their perfectly-synced
column19: elaborate choreography on stage and in their music videos. Twitter gave them a special emoji; the bandâ€™s U.S. shows sold out in hours.ELLE.com interviewed BTS ahead of the award show about what winning Billboardâ€™s Top Social Artist award would mean to them
column20: how they came together at company Big Hit Entertainment (in South Korea
column21: music companies recruit and put together bands of artists called idols) and what to expect next.U.S. news outlets say youâ€™re on the cusp of â€œblowing upâ€ in the U.S. How has it felt for you guys taking in all this?Rap Monster: I think so many miracles have happened
column22: from Twitter emoji to the Billboard Music Awards. But at the same time
column23: weâ€™re just getting started and there are still more amazing things to accomplish for BTS and we cant wait for that to happen.J-Hope: Itâ€™s such an honor for BTS
column24: and Iâ€™d have to say itâ€™s only a beginning. We want to and will go further and higher. Itâ€™s all possible with the support of our fans around the world.Jungkook: Itâ€™s sometimes just unbelievable; partially maybe it was a bit of luck. But we do our best and keep working no matter what. The fans supported us so much
column25: they love us. Weâ€™d like to go higher from here.What would it mean to you guys to win the Top Social Artist award at the BBMAs?Rap Monster: Itâ€™s just an awesome thing to happen for BTSâ€”first
column26: being invited to the BBMAs where all these top-notch artists gather in the same place. If we win Top Social Artists Award
column27: it is made possible by A.R.M.Ys (our fans) around the world
column28: and our honor and gratitude goes directly to them.What impact would you like to make on the U.S. music scene?Suga: I want to be on the Billboard Hot 100 with a single that has Korean lyrics.Jimin: I wish BTS could set up a model for k-pop with the best music and content so we have a positive impact on the U.S. music scene.Can you tell me a bit about your backstory? You are all incredible lyricists
column30: and dancers. How did you build those skills and know music was your calling?Rap Monster: I loved writing lyrics for rap when I was in junior high. I loved studying
column31: but somehow I wanted to be a rapper who can write and rap.Suga: I have [been] writing rhymes and lyrics
column32: a habit since I was a kid. They are all the little minor feelings and thoughts that go through my mind. I shuffle them a year or so later
column33: and they sometimes become great lyrics for songs.J-Hope: When I was a little kid
column34: I simply loved music and enjoyed expressing myself with my body. Everyone liked me when I went up on the stage at a talent search in elementary school
column35: and thatâ€™s when I decided to become a music artist.How did all seven of you come together to join your company Big Hit Entertainmentâ€”and ultimately
column36: the final line up of BTS?Rap Monster: I was introduced to our executive producer
column38: and auditioned in front of him. He told me later that he felt his destiny was to create a â€œhip-hop idol bandâ€ when he first met me. SUGA joined the team after me and j-hope was the third member (he was quite popular for his dancing in his hometown). With the rest of the four members joining the band
column39: BTS was born in 2013.You guys are going to the Billboard Music Awards ceremony. What are you most looking forward to?Jin: Everything!! Itâ€™s my first time in Las Vegas and at the BBMAs. column41: and they were special moments.V: Every one of the shows on the U.S.â€”the tour was unforgettable. Personally
column42: it was my favorite moments when I went to MoMA [Museum of Modern Art] in NY and the Chicago Art Museum.What sets you apart from other k-pop groups is the fact you are so personal in your lyrics and willing to speak out about mental health. How have the songs youâ€™ve writtenâ€”and expressing those feelings through musicâ€”helped you grow as young men?Rap Monster: My songs have made me someone who constantly observes society and wants to be a person who can have [a] better

column44: and things donâ€™t always work out well
column45: but we should be brave and go on with our lives.J-Hope: We deliver many different messages to people of our generation. I want them to get good energy by listening to BTS music.Jimin: It would be really great if our music continues to touch people. Once your heart is moved
column46: it will develop to something better and positive.â€œONCE YOUR HEART IS MOVED
